intro: Rhabdadenia macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered rhabdadenia, is a perennial shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a somewhat rough texture. Rhabdadenia macrantha is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
